cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 225 miles E of Caibarién, Cuba and 380 miles SE of Miami, Florida

motion.direction: W (expected to turn WNW later today)

cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest near the north coast of Cuba, then curving northwest toward the Florida Keys/South Florida Sunday and moving northward inland over the Florida peninsula, Georgia and the Carolinas early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time for South Carolina
weather_observation.warning_coast: None at this time for South Carolina
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible beginning Monday evening with about a 28 % cumulative chance; low (9 %) chance of 50-kt winds and 4 % chance of hurricane-force winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge possible but no official surge watch/warning for South Carolina yet.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast totals of 3–6 inches with isolated higher amounts could cause localized flash flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents are expected ahead of the storm.
